Title: Top Performing stocks: Super Stars! These 44 stocks gave over 1,000% returns during Modi government’s 9-year stint
Description:
The ruling government, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi , will in a few months celebrate the success of its second term.
A glance at the influence Modi had not only on desi but also the videshi investors in the last nine years clearly reflects in the Indian stock market performance.India witnessed the highest-ever inflows from both foreign institutional investors and domestic investors during Modi’s 9-year stint.
Shares of Bajaj Finance have given stellar returns of 3,280% in 9 years, and parent Bajaj Finserv 1,513% returns.Cloud solutions provider Tanla Platforms was at the top of the list, as the stock has given a staggering 11,325% returns in 9 years.
At least 210 stocks from Nifty500 pack have given triple-digit returns to investors in nine years.The outlook for domestic equities for the next six months is not extremely bullish as global headwinds persist which will bring bouts of volatility.

Title: FMCG, realty stocks power Indian shares on May series expiry day
Description:
BENGALURU, May 25 (Reuters) - Indian shares advanced on Thursday, led by fast moving consumer goods and realty stocks, while the ongoing U.S. debt talks weighed on sentiment and capped gains.
The blue-chip Nifty 50 (.NSEI) index closed 0.20% higher at 18,321.15, while the benchmark S&P BSE Sensex (.BSESN) rose 0.16% to 61,872.62.
Both the benchmarks fell nearly 0.5% during the session, before reversing losses in the last hour on May derivatives series expiry day volatility.
Exchanges place stocks in short-term or long-term ASM frameworks to caution investors about high volatility in share prices.
($1 = 82.7271 Indian rupees)Reporting by Bharath Rajeswaran in Bengaluru; Editing by Sonia CheemaOur Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.

Title: LIC buys additional shares in Tata Power, Bata India. Here are details
Description:
Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Thursday informed stock exchanges that the life insurer has increased its holding in two stocks namely Tata Power and Bata India.
In April 2019, LIC held 18,90,70,215 shares or 5.917 per cent stake in Tata Power, the insurer told exchanges.
Besides, LIC said its shareholding in Bata India increased to 83,95,740 shares or 6.532 per cent stake from 64,36,692 shares or 5.01 per cent stake as on March 31.
LIC held 57,80,329 shares or 4.497 per cent stake in Bata India as on March 15, 2023.
In the case of Bata India, LIC said its holdings jumped 2.035 percentage points from March 15 to May 24.

Title: Ashish Kacholia portolio stock Gravita India starts commercial production of rubber recycling at Tanzania plant
Description:
Gravita India has informed stock exchanges that commercial production and recycling of waste rubber has started at its plant in Tanzania in East Africa.
Gravita India is a leading recycling company, having a manufacturing presence around the globe.
The company has also plans to establish similar rubber recycling facilities at its other manufacturing locations.
Earlier this month, Gravita India raised 34 million euros loan facility from two European developmental financial institutions.
Jaipur-based Gravita is a leading recycling company with 11 manufacturing facilities across the globe.

Title: Info Edge India shares rally 8% as operating margin sustains at 39% sequentially despite tepid topline growth
Description:
stocklive bse livense live Volume Todays L/H More ×Info Edge India shares gained 7.6 percent on May 26 after the internet company turned profitable in the March FY23 quarter on a standalone basis with sustaining operating margin despite tepid revenue growth.
The standalone profit stood at Rs 178.93 crore for the fourth quarter of FY23, against a loss of Rs 84.26 crore in the previous quarter.
For the March FY23 quarter, it reported an exceptional loss of Rs 18.7 crore including Rs 13.7 crore related to the abovementioned impairment of investment in 4B Networks.
On a year-on-year basis, the standalone bottomline growth was 48.2 percent and the topline grew by 23.8 percent, with the recruitment business (Naukri) growing 27 percent.
On a consolidated basis, Info Edge has posted a loss of Rs 272.8 crore for the fourth quarter of FY23, widening from Rs 116.5 crore in the previous quarter.

Title: Coal India shares at Rs 340? Nuvama upped target for stock post management meet
Description:

Description:

Title: How the NSE turned a bad year for India’s stock market into a great one for itself
Description:
Register or LoginFor an entity that is a near-monopoly, the National Stock Exchange of India’s (NSE) financials don’t attract much attention.
That’s because, unlike rival BSE (formerly the Bombay Stock Exchange), the NSE is privately held.
Even so, the NSE’s financials attest to its ever-growing dominance dominance The Ken How India’s National Stock Exchange turned from solution to problem Read more and its ability to withstand the vicissitudes of capital markets.
Anyone wanting to own NSE shares must wait two to four months, as the stock exchange goes through the process of approving each shareholder.
The BSE, long used to playing second fiddle to the NSE, is once again trying to chip away at the latter’s dominance.

Title: Gravita India shares gains on capacity expansion of Chittoor plant
Description:
Gravita Indialive bse livense live Volume Todays L/H More ×Gravita India share price gained 2 percent on May 26 after it the company said that it had expanded the capacity of its recycling unit in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor.
The existing capacity of the unit for battery recycling has been increased by 26,440 MTPA, taking the total capacity to 64,640 MTPA, the compnay told exchanges.
With this, the expansion total capacity of Gravita Group has reached 2.78 lakh MTPA, which is in line with the company’s target of 4.25 lakh MTPA by FY26.
Catch up on all LIVE stock market updates hereThe investment in the said capacity expansion is around Rs 21 crore which has been funded through internal accruals, Gravita India said in its filing to exchanges.
The stock was trading at Rs 563 on the NSE, up 2.24 percent with a volume of 1.44 lakh shares.

Title: Why Indian stock market has been rising for last six sessions — explained
Description:
Indian stock market closed higher on all five sessions in the week gone by.

US dollar holds keySpeaking on the reason for rising Indian stock market, Anuj Gupta, Vice President — Research at IIFL Securities said, "Due to weakness in the US dollar, FIIs have been fishing out money from the currency market and pumping in Indian equities.

Title: 3 Nifty stocks to trade ex-dividend this week. Do you own any?
Description:
Shares of three Nity stocks, State Bank of India ITC , and Infosys , will trade ex-dividend this week.ITC's Board has recommended a final dividend of Rs 6.75 and a special dividend of Rs 2.75 per equity share.
ITC will trade ex-dividend on May 30.Shares of companies trade ex-dividend on the day of record date or a day before.
When a company goes ex-dividend on a particular date, its stock does not carry the value of the next dividend payment.
The date of payment is fixed on June 14.The lender fixed May 31 as the record date for the said dividend payment and will trade ex-dividend on the same date.
SBI will trade ex-dividend on May 31.Meanwhile, IT services company Infosys has announced to pay a final dividend of Rs 17.50 per equity share for the financial year ended March 31.

Title: ABB India stock at new 52-week high; does this rally have more legs?
Description:
Shares of ABB India Ltd hit a new 52-week high of ₹3,789.60 on the National Stock Exchange on Monday after it reported robust March quarter (Q1CY23) earnings.
ABB India follows a January to December financial year.
Revenue rose 22.5% year-on-year (YoY) in Q1CY23, driven by improved execution and favourable product mix.
Analysts said that ABB's Q1CY23 order book, valued at around ₹7,170 crore, provides revenue visibility for the next few quarters.
These factors have led some analysts to revise their earnings estimates upwards.

Title: GAIL India Q4 earnings: Stock slips over 4% as net profit tumbles 77%
Description:
Shares of GAIL India slipped over 4 per cent today after the state-owned gas utility reported a weak set of earnings for the quarter ended March 2023.
Standalone profit plunged 77.5 percent year-on-year to Rs 603 crore in Q4 against the net profit of Rs 2683 crore in the year-ago period.
Subsequently, GAIL India stock touched an intraday low of Rs 104.75, down 4.77% on BSE.
Earlier, GAIL India stock opened flat at Rs 110.65 today.
GAIL India shares trade higher than the 100 day and 200 day moving averages but lower than 5 day, 20 day and 50 day moving averages.

Title: Does the global recession impact India’s stock market?
Description:
The global markets witnessed massive volatility in 2022 as Russia and Ukraine entered into a conflict, inflation reached multi-decade highs and rising concerns of global recession spooked investors.
According to the IMF, the global economy is set to grow at 2.8% for 2023 with a recession expected in the US.
Despite this slowdown in the global economy, India will continue to be amongst the fastest-growing emerging countries.
According to the RBI, India’s GDP growth is expected at 6.5% in FY24 whereas IMF expects India’s growth at 5.9% for FY24.
The rural economy has been hit hard during the pandemic and is yet to fully recover from its impact.

Title: India Stock Outlook: Last Leg Of Q4 Earnings, Foreign Fund Inflow Patterns Key Triggers
Description:
Coming to the foreign portfolio investors, they have been net buyers in India for the third month on a trot now, helping buoy Indian stocks.
FPIs bought assets worth Rs 11,631 crore in Indian stock markets in April, according to NSDL data.
In March, they purchased assets worth about Rs 7,936 crore in Indian stock markets.
Barring some exceptions, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) had been selling equities in the Indian markets for over a year, which started in October 2021 for various reasons.
In 2022, foreign portfolio investors sold Rs 121,439 crore worth of stocks in India on a cumulative basis.

Title: India’s stock market makeover | World Business Watch | Latest World News | English News | WION
Siemens India's unit sale to parent against the interest of minority investors: Analysts
Description:
Mumbai: At least four brokerages including Nomura Jefferies , Haitong and IDBI Capital have raised concerns over Siemens India's move to sell its gear motor business to its parent.
""What is concerning is that the business has been transferred to the parent entity at 16.7x FY22 EPS when the entire Indian entity trades at 86x FY22 earnings," IDBI Capital said in its report.
"This bodes negatively for minority shareholders in India on account of the unfavourable valuation at which the divestment has been done.
Basis their view, the board decided to take the higher end of their recommended valuation.
The brokerage said the unit accounted for 7% of Siemens India's FY22 sales and 9% of its profits.Nomura on Tuesday downgraded the stock and cut the target price to ₹3,521 citing weak motors growth outlook and governance concerns.

Title: Coal India’s stock remains attractive despite decline in Q4 profits
Description:
The company’s revenue from operations increased by 16.5 per cent year-on-year to ₹38,152.3 crore, which was 8.17 per cent higher than the consensus estimates.
PerformanceThe company produced nearly 224.16 million tonnes (mt) of coal during the quarter, up 7.25 per cent y-o-y, while its offtake rose by 3.68 per cent to 186.87 mt.
The sales from offtake through fuel supply arrangements (FSA) increased by about 17 per cent because of 11 per cent higher volume offtake and five per cent higher realisation.
Though the base price hike was not there, a better volume mix has led to higher FSA realisation per tonne.
85 per cent up y-o-y, on account of which sales through e-auction rose by 10 per cent despite around 41 per cent fall in volumes.

Title: How technology is changing the trading landscape
Description:
The evolution of stock market trading in India started below a Banyan tree in Mumbai in 1855 by a few people which then moved on to Ring base trading in the BSE building.
Then came the 1990’s which transformed trading from a traditional open floor trading system to a sophisticated electronic screen-based trading system commonly known as BOLT on BSE and NEAT on NSE.
20% of the total exchange trading volumes came from Mobile trading.
The emergence of numerous Fintech startups has led to a paradigm shift in the stock market world.
The future belongs to Voice command-based trading, Bot Trading, and the predominant use of AI in taking logical investment decisions.

Title: Multibagger smallcap stock announces 2:5 bonus issue, Rs 6 dividend
Description:
The board of Aptech approved an interim dividend and bonus issue of equity shares to investors.
The company declared an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share for the financial year 2023.The said dividend payment is subject to the approval of shareholders in the annual general meeting.
When a company goes ex-dividend on a particular date, its stock does not carry the value of the next dividend payment.Apart from the dividend, the company's board has also approved a bonus issue of equity shares in the proportion of 2:5.
For every five equity shares investors hold, they will get additional two bonus shares as proposed by the company.
When a firm issues bonus shares, its shareholders do not have to incur any extra costs to get them.

Title: AI is becoming the stock market’s answer to everything
Description:
BloombergBloombergBloombergRarely does a tech-powered stock rally come along that isn’t pilloried for the fragility of its foundation.
In the S&P 500, the unweighted version is losing by the widest market since Bloomberg’s data began in 1990.To much of the pundit class, the situation is replete with risk: what happens to the market when the hype-cycle around AI ends?
“If the leadership was all crappy companies like we saw in 2000, it would be game over very shortly.”Warnings that this type of concentration will incinerate the wider stock market have been a recurring feature of commentary year after year.
And if this AI thing is what we all think it will be, there’ll be a lot of opportunities beyond Nvidia.”One constituency the oligarchic rally is indisputably creating headaches for is stock pickers.
Yet despite all the traps lain in front of the market — recession, falling profits, an aggressive Federal Reserve — stocks have refused to budge.

Title: India is up for a good growth story: Jinesh Gopani
Description:
"I think in all aspects, it looks like India is up for a good growth story and that is what we are witnessing even in the companies who are demonstrating good growth capabilities on ground," says Jinesh Gopani , Head Equities, Axis MF ..India is much better shape than what is around the world.
So when you are looking at large economies going into mild recession or into recession or the growth rates not being that great, I think India is looking like the sweet spot.
But if you see the data points, I think China's recovery is also uneven and the growth rates are not as expected.
In fact, we are finding over the last two quarters that not all companies in a sector are able to deliver good growth or good margins vis-à-vis the valuation where they are.
Profit pools are shrinking to few companies and whosoever is able to demonstrate good growth visibility as well as good margins, I think they will win the race.

Title: Bearish options cast doubt on India, EM Asia’s best stock market

Title: Top Performing stocks: Super Stars! These 44 stocks gave over 1,000% returns during Modi government’s 9-year stint
Description:
The ruling government, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi , will in a few months celebrate the success of its second term.
A glance at the influence Modi had not only on desi but also the videshi investors in the last nine years clearly reflects in the Indian stock market performance.India witnessed the highest-ever inflows from both foreign institutional investors and domestic investors during Modi’s 9-year stint.
Shares of Bajaj Finance have given stellar returns of 3,280% in 9 years, and parent Bajaj Finserv 1,513% returns.Cloud solutions provider Tanla Platforms was at the top of the list, as the stock has given a staggering 11,325% returns in 9 years.
At least 210 stocks from Nifty500 pack have given triple-digit returns to investors in nine years.The outlook for domestic equities for the next six months is not extremely bullish as global headwinds persist which will bring bouts of volatility.
(Data inputs from Ritesh Presswala)(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own.

Title: Investor Madhuri Kela acquires stake in Repro India - Stock gains for seventh straight day
Description:
Based on the March quarter shareholding pattern, the Malabar India Fund held 4.56 percent stake in the company.
Shares of publishing company Repro India rallied more than 14 percent to hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 575 on Tuesday, extending its gains for the seventh day in a row.
Today's gains come after investor and founder of MK Ventures, Madhuri Madhusudan Kela, picked 4.75 lakh shares of the company.

The stock had ended locked in an upper circuit of 20 percent on Monday.

Title: Tailwinds are back? 5 stocks from auto ancillary space with an upside potential up to 26%
Description:
5 stocks from auto ancillary space with an upside potential up to 26%Lumax Industries Limited is a company that is engaged in the business of manufacturing, trading and supply of auto components, mainly automotive lighting systems for four-wheeler and two-wheeler vehicles.
SynopsisWhile it might surprise many, the fact is that the majority of sales in the auto industry are financed through an auto loan.
That is the reason why in the second half of 2018 when the NBFC crisis happened, one of the biggest hits was taken by the auto industry and hence auto ancillary.
Now things are coming back to normal as companies have made adjustments for many other headwinds.We take a look at companies where analysts are projecting further upside in the next 12 months.
The list is based on upside estimated by the analysts, with the highest potential stock coming on the top of the list.

Title: India's Gautam Adani is back in the top 20 billionaires' list
Description:
The Adani group chairman, whose net worth has risen by $4.38 billion this week to $64.2 billion, is now ranked 18th on the Bloomberg Billionaires’ Index.
Investors dumped Adani group stocks over the next months, resulting in an erosion of $56.4 billion from his personal wealth .
Besides retail investors, the Adani stock’s revival has cheered India’s largest insurer Life Insurance Corporation (LIC), too.
The value of LIC’s Adani investments has also recoveredThe rebounding Adani stock has replenished more than half of LIC’s wealth lost in the Hindenburg-led implosion.
Its other Adani holdings include Adani Total Gas (6.02%), Adani Enterprises (4.26%), Adani Transmission (3.68%), and Adani Green Energy (1.36%).
